snippet: When a Manhattan man found out that Time Warner Cable would begin charging a $4 monthly rental fee to use its cable modem, he started researching modems he could buy to avoid paying the fee. But he soon stumbled across an odd inconsistency in the way...
abstract: When a Manhattan man found out that Time Warner Cable would begin charging a $4 monthly rental fee to use its cable modem, he started researching modems he could buy to avoid paying the fee. But he soon stumbled across an odd inconsistency in the way the company is applying the fee.

headline.main: A Quirk in Time Warner Cable's New Modem Fee
